India’s IT sector continues to grow, projecting $100 billion in GCC revenue by 2030.

title: Thaw in ties: India, China to resume direct flights by month-end

This decision aims to restore normalcy in bilateral ties and expand people-to-people contact, contingent on commercial decisions and fulfilling operational criteria by designated carriers.

title: Benign Prostate Enlargement: What men should know about urinary health
description: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) commonly affects men over 50, causing urinary issues due to an enlarged prostate. Age, hormones, genetics, and lifestyle contribute to its development. Early diagnosis and timely treatment, including medications and advanced options like water vapor therapy now available in India, are crucial to manage symptoms, prevent complications, and significantly improve quality of life.

title: Shedeur Sanders responds to Rex Ryan's criticism after viral locker-room clip
description: Cleveland Browns rookie Shedeur Sanders went viral for a silent, mimed locker-room interview after Dillon Gabriel was named starter. The incident sparked debate about its meaning and media culture, with his parents publicly defending his actions.

It will also examine gaps in schooling, awareness of career options, and the fairness of entrance tests. Recommendations may lead to changes aimed at reducing exam stress and coaching dependence.

Police confronted an armed man, with an officer heard shouting about a bomb during the evacuation. The incident, involving a car and stabbing, prompted the Prime Minister to condemn the assault and deploy additional security to UK synagogues.

description: Chennai-born Aravind Srinivas, 31, has emerged as India's youngest billionaire, debuting on the M3M Hurun India Rich List 2025 with a net worth of Rs 21,190 crore from his AI startup Perplexity. His entry highlights a significant shift in India's wealth landscape, driven by young tech entrepreneurs in AI and digital platforms.

'I Love Muhammad' row fallout: Bareilly on high alert, drones deployed; net suspended
description: Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly division is under heightened security for Dussehra, with drones and armed police deployed. Bareilly district faces a 48-hour internet suspension until October 4, following September 26 unrest. This measure aims to curb rumour-mongering and communal tension on social media. Four districts are on high alert, with officials warned against lapses.

He praised India's strong performance and composure throughout the tournament, highlighting Tilak Varma's crucial innings in their triumph.

description: Rahul Gandhi, Leader of Opposition, accused the BJP-led central government of a “wholesale attack on Indian democracy” during an interaction in Colombia, emphasizing India's diverse traditions needing democratic space. The BJP hit back, calling him a “Leader of Propaganda” for denigrating Indian democracy abroad and wanting to "fight Indian state."

This offensive, a recurring BJP poll strategy, targets the opposition ahead of elections, particularly in the Muslim-majority Seemanchal region. While BJP officially cites development, the infiltration narrative aims to reshape electoral dynamics, echoing past campaigns in Delhi and Jharkhand.

The restoration symbolizes renewal after the defacement.

Her journey exemplifies balancing professional ambition with heartfelt personal experiences, showcasing how intentionality transforms a busy life into a meaningful one.

Singh stressed that while India has the power to respond forcefully, its actions remain focused on countering terrorism, not waging war.

MP: Teacher, wife bury newborn alive over 2-child policy fear; baby survives
description: A government school teacher and his wife in Madhya Pradesh allegedly buried their three-day-old son alive in a forest, fearing job loss under the state's two-child policy. The baby, their fourth child, miraculously survived after villagers rescued him. The couple now faces attempt-to-murder charges, revealing a tragic consequence of the policy and MP's high infant abandonment rates.

title: Inside Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner’s private love story lasting 15 years
description: Sidney Crosby and Kathy Leutner maintain a private relationship. Leutner began modeling in 2005, appearing in Sports Illustrated in 2011. She works with fashion brands. Crosby achieved significant hockey success. They met in 2008. Both built impressive careers. They prioritize privacy. Their bond thrives away from public attention.

title: Connor McDavid’s contract extension in doubt after Kirill Kaprizov’s massive deal
description: Connor McDavid's contract future with the Edmonton Oilers is under intense scrutiny following Kirill Kaprizov's massive deal. Despite McDavid's potential for a record-setting salary, the Oilers face significant cap challenges due to existing high-value contracts. McDavid prioritizes winning a Stanley Cup, suggesting he might accept less to ensure a competitive team, forcing Edmonton to find creative financial solutions.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won’t be updated until…
description: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: Accenture job cuts: Company lays off thousands that can't be AI trained; what CEO said
description: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands globally, citing employees' inability to retrain for AI roles. Despite these cuts, the company plans to expand its headcount next fiscal year, aggressively building AI capabilities and training over 550,000 staff. CEO Julie Sweet confirmed 'exiting' non-AI-aligned talent, reflecting a broader tech industry trend where adapting to AI is crucial for professional relevance.
